 <math alttext="332"> <mn>332</mn> </math>

 <math alttext="291"><mn>291</mn></math>

A builder is trying to find the maximum area that can be bounded by a rectangular region on a certain plot of land. The builder determined four different areas based on the length <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> of one side of the rectangle, for four different rectangles. The table gives values of the one side of the rectangle, in meters (m), and the corresponding area, in square meters (<math alttext="m squared"><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>). After noticing that as <math alttext="x"> <mi>x</mi> </math> increases, the area values increase and then decrease, the builder used a quadratic regression to produce a function <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> that models the area based on the constraints.
content.question: Of the following, what is the maximum value of <math alttext="A open parentheses x close parentheses"> <mi>A</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> </math>, to the nearest integer, based on the model?

topic.text: 1.13: Function Model Selection and Assumption Articulation

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
